Can. Pours a clear brown colour with a foamy beige head. Aroma of chocolate, cookie dough, some nuts, slight toffee and subtle spicy hops. 
Taste is similar of chocolate, cookie dough, some nuts, slight roasted malts, a little toffee and subtle spicy hops. Light bodied and moderate carbonation. A short, sweetish, roasted bitterness in the finish. A little sweet with, not the most appealing dark malt flavours and a subtle bitterness. Ok but a little thin.

Bottle. Pours a clear, reddish brown color with a light beige head. Malty aroma with wort, toffee and some roasted malt. The flavour is also malty and sweet with milk chocolate and roasted tones. Just a touch with diacetyl. Has a medium body, soft mouth feel and a light bitterness. A sweet and roasted lager with lots of malt. Well balanced and easy drinking.
Barwa brunatna, piana opada i znika całkowicie. W aromacie nuty palone, karmelowe. W smaku wodniste, puste, lekkie nuty palone.

Actually not that bad. I find the biggest fault for me to be the thin body here. It is literally watery feeling. Also the head disappears quickly. Clear dark amber-brown colour. Mostly roasted flavours, roast, coffee. Light to moderate sweetness and light to moderate bitterness. Light to moderate carbonation.

6 Marzo 2016. From Hipercor. In Bavaria glass. Playing Millenium 2. Watery and unpleasantly sweet. Finishing it is very tiring. Avg 1.7

27 Feb 2021. De Combini. En copa de hefe de Bavaria. En almuerzo, con garbanzos con chorizo + Donuts. Dulzona pero no la infamia que recordaba, y el cuerpo no resulta nada aguado teniendo en cuenta su abv.
On tap @ Cesky Krumlov, CZ. Dark brown to black color with a dark head. Aroma of malts, sweetness, toffee and coffee. Sweet taste with a long finishing. Low carbonated, easily drinkable.

Pite w Czechach, tak samo nijakie jak i to sprzedawane w Polsce. Barwa brunatna, pod światło wiśniowe refleksy. Piana słaba i szybko znika do zera. W aromacie cukrowa słodycz i lekka paloność. W smaku nijakie, puste, lekka paloność, wodniste.

Pours dark ruby, almost black with short lasting beige head. Smell of roasted malts.

Thin body with medium carbonation. Aroma of roasted malts, notes of coffee and chocolate. End result is very weak, thin and watery. Watered down dark lager.

Overall, very easy to drink - especially during hot summer days. However, at the end if the day, it’s mediocre and nothing to write home about. Bland.
Lahká chuť pražených sladov, kávy, hnedo-biela pena ktorá po naliati vydržala malú chvíľu, chuť celkom slušná

A nice malty smell of chocolate. The head is small, beige and foamy with a normal carbonation. Thee body is dark brown. A light malty taste of chocolate, light metallic. The body is light, a little bit creamy with a normal carbonation.
Botellín 500ml. Vaso de pinta irlandesa. Cerveza muy suave, con un sabor dulce a café. Un poco más de graduación sería lo ideal. No está mal.

0,5lt bottle @ Valentin - Curious Bierkneipe, Volos, Greece
Light body, brown sugar sweet with little aroma and fast aftertaste. Easy to drink nothing special
Una cerveza que muchos la encontrarán como una buena opción porque entra fácil, pero lo cierto es que le falta cuerpo, muy poco carbonatada, y notas inapreciables. Una completa decepción.

Aroma: very little of that; a bit of roastiness and a whiff of honey.
 Appearance: black, opaque, head large, lasts for about a second.
 Taste: mildly sweet, marginally bitter.
 Palate: body pretty light; carbonation fizzy at first, quickly fizzles out; finish a little astringent, mildly sweet.
 Overall: if they inverted the beer to water ratio, this could probably be a nice drink. It’s still more fun than pure water but a bit too homeopathic to have any effect on the senses.

500ml can from supermarket. Pours black with medium tanned head which quickly diminishes, soft carbonation. Aroma mainly from roasted malt, bit of hops... you can sense the added sugar. Medium to heavy sweetness, lightly bitter. Ok.

0.5l can, bought in a Spar supermarket in Budapest. A great classic in my memories from the old days of U Cerneho Vola. But the old days are gone, I have changed a lot and I suspect this beer has changed a lot, too. Not to better, unfortunately.
Starts with a dark brown body with a nice and thick beige head. Could be more persistent, though. Aroma is neutral, a bit of cocoa. Foam is very sweet, plus again some cocoa and some bread-like sourness. Tastes sweet. Dominantly sweet with hints of cocoa and coke. A bit of chocolate for some subsecond moments. Watery as well, not surprising givent the alcohol content. Palate is coke-like, not very convincing. In the end coke is coming more and more forward in the taste as well, which spoils the show quite a bit.
Kind of OK light Prager dunkel, but far from the classic beer of my memories, so it was a dissapointment for me in the end.
0.5l bottle in moscow. pours a clear dark chestnut with a small off-white head and little lacing. aroma of caramel malts, chocolate. flavour of chocolate, coke, caramel. minimal bitterness.
Butelka 0,5l Kolor ciemnobrązowy, piany brak. Aromat lekko słodowy w smaku karmel, trochę goryczki i słodkie. Piwo nijakie, nieprzyjemne na podniebieniu.
dark brown with creamy tan head, aroma of roasty malt, faint hops. tastes of choco and dark malts. decent enough

Bottle. Clear brown with shades of ruby and a huge foamy beige head. Aroma of malts, caramel and a faint dose of hops. Taste is malts and caramel galore  plus some nuts. Medium to strong carbonation. Thin body. Easy drinking and refreshing. Quite flavourful for it's low abv.

Uma cerveja muito fraca, peca pelo doce inocente e pela falta de uma boa contraposição. Parece muito uma malzebier. Não recomendo. 

 ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Can at 4-6°C. Pours medium light brown head. Dark brown /ruby color. Clear. In nose aromas of toast, earth,  caramel and chocolate. In flavor also presence of nuts. More sweet than bitter. Medium body. Overall: nice, easy drinkable beer. And very flavorful for that low percent of alcohol.  Maybe too sweet so it reminds me, just a little bit, on maltzbier.

Dark brown clear color (like Cola) with little brown minimal head. Nice roasty and coffee aroma. Taste is from beginning caramel sweet, very watery in the middle and hoppy bitterness in the end? Look fo it somewhere else.
Typical dark eurobeer...

Flasche 0,5l: Schwarz, kräftiger feinporiger, stabiler Schaum; sehr würzige Nase, leichte malzige Süße, kräftige Röstaromen, leichte Hopfennoten, ungeröstete Kaffeebohnen, Kaffee; recht leichter Körper, würzig, dunkle Süße, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, dunkle Fruchtigkeit, etwas schwach
500 ml, butelka. Aromat słodowy, karmel, palone trochę. W smaku goryczka bardzo niska. Wodniste.
Redbrown, clearceith nice brownish foam. Malt, dry bisquet in the aroma. Sweet, sweet, toffee with sweet aftertaste.

Clear beer. Color- coca cola. Nice big beige head, stays very long, nice lacing on the glass.
Aroma: Caramel, caramel, more caramel, some dark malts and yeasts (like smelling the yeasts). In fact, it smells exactly like kvass. 
Taste: caramelly sweetness, nothing else. Kvass mixed with a lot of water.
Palate: light body, high saturation, watery.
Overall: Mix kvass with a lot of water and you’ll get this kind of shit.

Nutty, toasty and rich caramel maltiness smell.
Taste is very much like the smell but with sweet caramel dominating.
Fairly light mouthfeel given the richness of the sweet caramel smell and taste.
Nice beer.
Can. Aroma of roasted caramalts. Taste is balanced, but really caramelly in the finish, very much reminds me of a Polish non-alcoholic beer called Karmi. Pretty ok dessert beer, this one.
Very nice beer. Dark colour, caramel taste and overall sweet and no bitterness whatsoever.
Dark brown, including the head. Aroma is oddly fruity, with an emphasis on forest berries. Light smokiness but generally pretty sweet.

Can shared with TO in OSB band bus in Czech Republic. Brown. Fruity aroma and taste of dark malt, dark syrup and fried vegetables.

From tap at U Cerneho Vola in Prague with Gunnars ryk & reis. Similar as orevious rating, and with loads and loads of butterscotch. Foamy, dense and persistent beige head.
Barwa ciemna, klarowna. Aronat karmelowy, kawowy. W smaku lekko wodniste, slodkie, karmelowe.

Clear dark reddish brown colour, beige head. Malty aroma, caramel. Sweet malty flavour, caramel, hint of brown sugar. Bit thin. Sweet malty finish. Nice and refreshing, actually.
(from 50cL can @ tdr’s place. Thanks for sharing, Erwin!)

Drunk on draught in bar in Prague. Relatively light easily drinkable dark beer.
 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark in colour with taned long lasting head. Carmel and chocolate tones with hops. Watery...but still ok.

The foam is nice, dense and long. Large malty profile in the aroma. The taste is initially easy water, but also reveals great malty and sweet flavor that only allow sporadic hops. Easy to drink and very rich.
Draught. Pours pitch black with a fading beige head. Aroma of milk chocolate, oats, liquorice. Taste is of chocolate, liquorice, metallic finish. Soft carbonation, smooth watery mouthfeel.
Dark brown with quick fading head. Aroma and flavour have sweet dark malts. Some hints of chocolate. Ok for a low strength beer.

Liker the soft caramel taste. Missed some aftertaste but overall it was a god beer. 

 ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Aroma of malt and caramel, pours a reddish brown with a foamy tan head and some lacing. Watery feel with a sweet caramel malt taste. No real finish.

Barwa ciemno brunatna, piwo klarowne. Zapach średnio intensywny: karmel, przypalona skórka od chleba i kwaśne niuanse lurowatej kawy. W smaku lekko wodniste, mało intensywne, karmel, przypieczona skórka od chleba. Lekko słodkie, goryczki brak.
Bottle from Russian supermarket. Dark brown, red color. Thin beige head. High sweetness. Aroma is malty, light chocolate.

Butelka 0.5l (28.12.2015). Piwo klarowne o brązowej barwie, rubinowej pod światło z jasno-beżową pianą, średnio obfitą, drobnęj o kremowej konsystencji, subtelnie krążkującej. Aromat całkiem przyjemny z wyraźnymi nutami słodów ciemnych i jakimś delikatnym smrodkiem w tle ale nie przeszkadzającym za bardzo. W smaku wyraźnie słodkie z lekkimi nutami słodów ciemnych, prażonymi, totalnie bez goryczki. Piwo bardzo lekkie, zdecydowanie słodkie, w miare pijalne. Ogólnie całkiem przyzwoite choć jeśli mógłbym je okreslić to "kobiece" byłoby w miare trafnym określeniem.
Almost no aroma, mostly caramel taste. Light and easy to drink. A little bit too watery for my taste but not bad.
chocolate, coffee, nuts, roasty, smoke, alcohol, grass, brown, hazy, minimal head, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, light body, creamy, lively, long finish,

Aromat: karmelowy, pumpernikiel, słaba kawa, diacetyl trochę w "krówki", lekko palony 
Wygląd: przypomina cole, ale jakaś piana jest i utrzymuje się do końca 
Smak: słodkie karmelowe goryczka niska
Odczucie w ustach: puste, średnio nisko wysycone CO2.
Ogólnie: poprawne tmave piwo, mogłoby być lepsze

Piana średnio obfita, beżowa. Piwo brązowe, klarowne. Wysycenie średnie, piwo musujące. Średnio pełne. Goryczka średnio-niska. W smaku słodkie, lekko palone, owocowe. W aromacie - karmel, paloność, silnie czuć powidła.
500ml bottle. Dark brown color with beige head. Malty aroma, light roasted, caramel, bread, some licorice. Sweet taste like aroma. Light to medium oily body with soft carbonation.
----- I’ve tried it before joining to the RateBeer. -----

Ucice 12/8 2015. 50 cl bottle from local market (Voli). Beer drinking goat enjoying a Kozel on the label. Pours reddish brown with small off-white head which quickly disappears. Aroma of dark malts, caramel and syrup. Medium carbonation. Taste follows the nose. Lightly sweet with caramel and toffee without much bitterness. Nice schwarz bier - though a little too heavy on the sweet side.

From the tank at Lokal Dlouha. Surprised to see the low scores but I’m not sure what it’s like in the bottle. Solid dunkel, light enough to put down a few but flavorful. Was happy to have it as a break from the straight pilsners.
Keg joy burger bar. Prague. Clear red brown black. Toffe malt aroma taste same light hop bitters. Bit thin. Ok stuff. Drunk with a veal ribeye steak amazing!!!!

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 3D). Bottle 50 cl - Batch L5174 18:10. AROMA: slight sweet bread crust aroma with faint notes of caramel and some cereal (rice, corn). no hop aromas. APPEARANCE: dark ruby color and translucent. moderate-low tanned head with below average retention. TASTE: very dilluted caramel and roasted notes with a slight sweet background. low bitterness with a sweet finish. PALATE: thin body with low carbonation. OVERALL: a very poor czech dark lager.

The beer has a reddish brown color, like cola. The foam is almond colored and not very abundant. The beer looks delicious. The smell has some roasted barley, but it isn’t that strong. The bitter sweetroast aroma is nice. The taste is very mellow and has the same bittersweet roast flavor as the smell has. There is a tiny hoppy undertone. The palate isn’t that great, the beer misses some fizzling.
Gerai atrodo, sodri tamsi spalva, siek tiek laikosi ir puta. Kvapas gaivus, kaip ir skonis, jauciasi idomus paskonis. Lengvai salstelejes. Vidutiniskas tamsus alus.

Casi negra con algún tinte rojizo. Limpia. Un dedo de espuma manchada. Aroma algo lácteo y chocolate. En boca es ligera, de trago muy fácil y poco gas, algo aguada. El sabor es muy malteado y dulce, con notas de café. Floja y le falta carácter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aromat: delikatny, karmel i przypieczona skórka od chleba.
Wygląd: barwa ciemno-brązowa, klarowne, piana słaba.
Smak: lekka słodycz w postaci ledwo wyczuwalnych ciemnych słodów, goryczka niska.
Odczucie w ustach: bardzo mało ciała, wręcz wodniste, wysokie wysycenie.
Ogólne wrażenie: mierne piwo, bo o ile w aromacie coś się jeszcze dzieje, to w smaku i teksturze piwa jest słabo.
Fľaša 0,5 l z Tesco Nitra. Tmavá jantárová priehľadná farba, pekná nahnedlá pena, sladovo nugátová aróma. Chuť nasládlá, kávová, trochu vodová. V zložení cukor.

Copper color. Nice, high head.
Grassy aroma, coffee hints.
Very low bitterness, medium swetness. It’s watery.
Medium body, low carbonated.
Meh.
Takie sobie ciemne piwo. Średnio mi smakowało. Więcej go nie kupię.
Dark amber colour with average head.Caramel flavour without being overwhelming sweet .Good water quality.Nice finish.
Dark colour with white head, some caramel and malt flavour, quite light and simple
W smaku całkiem przyzwoite - spodziewałem się wodnistego piwa, ale takie nie jest. Fajnie palone, ciemne słody. Ciemna ceska desitka.
Aroma of sweet caramel and roasted malt. Dark red color, sparkling beer with minimal brown head. Taste of medium sweet caramel and roasted malts just like aroma. Medium body with sticky texture.

Canned. Slight head. The look is dark red brown, smells sweet, reminds the taste of caramel, roasted malt and toast. Visible fizz. Tastes sweet and a little bitter, aftertaste leaves the toast notes on the tongue. Palate feels full ant thick, even though it is not milky. Overall it matches with light food.
Bottle in a train. Pours dark brown color, beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel. Taste is sweet, lot of roasted malt, caramel.

Pours a dark brown color with a tan head that shows good retention. Aroma of toasted and chocolate malts. Deep notes of cocoa, butter, milk and hot chocolate. Really nice and enticing. Taste is moderately sweet, subtle and enveloping. It reaches a high peak after holding it in the mouth for a few seconds. Aftertaste is almost as intense. Tastes like a mixture betwen a Bock and a Porter. Velvety palate, smooth and medium carbonated. Medium bodied. Alcohol unnoticeable but shows layers of complexity despite being barely 3.8% ABV. By far the best dark beer I tried during my trip to Germany (so far...).
Dark amber color. Light aroma of malt, caramel, fudge. Weak body, with a sweetish taste, almost just caramel, and not bitter enough.

zahvaljujuci mom odlicnom frendu Bizonu (Miru) ja i Vedran smo probali i ovo pivo ...katastrofa pivo ... karamelast okus je jedino sto ima od crne pive ...prazan okus ..nema jakosti ni gorcine ..kakvo je to crno pivo s 3,8% alc...??

Draft at the Tap House in Pangyo, South Korea. Little head and deep dark brown colour. Also little malt flavour like toffee. Mild toffee taste, and finishes mild coffee flavour with some maple syrup, not special.

Barwa brunatna, przejrzysta, kremowa piana średniej wielkości i trwałości. Aromat karmelu, minimalnie kawowy, ogólnie dość słaby. W smaku karmel, lekka paloność, słaba goryczka i zdecydowanie za mało ciała. Pije się dobrze, ma w miarę dobry smak, ale zdecydowanie zbyt wodniste.
Bottle. Pour is dark, aroma is toffee, sweet. Taste is sweet, toffee, too thin. Average

Brown but not dark brown appearance and a little of quickly dissipating foam.Nice balanced taste. Chocolaty,caramel, earthy notes. No metallic taste detected. Easy drinking, wonderful and kind of longlasting aftertaste. Reccomended, 17/20
Rich malt flavours balanced perfectly with rich blend of earthy hops. Delicious. Recommended
Bottle 500 ml. Very poor dark beer. Watery taste and weak aroma. Kozel brand is really bad.
On tap. Retaining thin tan-mahogany. A-roasty med malt, some dk fruit. T-follows with some earthy hops

Butelka 0,5 l Aromat: karmelowy, znikoma paloność, i coś nie przyjemnego - jakby siarka,zapach kanalizacyjny. Barwa: brunatna, pod mocne światło rubinowe refleksy, klarowne. Piana: jasno beżowa, średnia, szybko opada, leasing brak. Smak: słodowość, bardzo wodniste, tak bardzo że piwo praktycznie nie ma smaku jest bez wyrazu, goryczki brak. Zaraz po kozelu piłem kormorana ciemnego (rate beer pokazuje obydwa piwa w tym samym stylu) który był w podobnej cenie ale o niebo lepszy, zresztą czego spodziewać się po koncerniaku, ale kapsel jest;)
500ml Flasche. Rabenschwarz und klar. Minimale Schaumkrone. Sehr malzig mit mildem Abgang. Gut trinkbar.

Bar Pionýr, Plzeň, Czechy. Piwo ciemne z rubinowymi przebłyskami. Piana Ladna drobno-pęcherzykowa oblepiająca szkło. Aromat: karmel i ciemne słody. W smaku słodycz, słaba goryczka, lekka paloność, karmel.
Can: 0,5L. Price: 0,73 €. Kreminė puta, geras alus, tinka kasdieniniam vartojimui

Birra poco carbonata e un corpo misero. Di colore molto scuro, al naso profumi cioccolatosi e caffettosi. Al gusto un po' piatta di sapori. Lager scura. 

---Rated BY Italianbeer85

Barwa ciemnomiedziana, piana bardzo szybko redukuje sie do skromnej obrączki. Słaby aromat karmelowy z jeszcze słabszymi śladami przypieczonej skórki. W smaku lekka słodowość, jednak przeważa wodnistość, trudno się zesztą spodziewać czegoś więcej po niskim ekstrakcie. Piwo zupełnie bez charakteru jednak bardzo lekkie co niewątpliwie jest zaletą w niektórych okolicznościach.

Recently held a dark beer tasting, and this was the first cab off the rank. I’ve had this beer several times before and thought it was OK - but match it with the right food and it is much, much better. We had this with BBQ pork ribs. And without eating it was a nice dark beer, but when eating this amazing smokey flavour came out of the beer (not the ribs because they were not smoked). All seven of us experienced the same thing. Definitely bumped up the taste rating to an eight. 
Good start to the evening.

Brown color with medium beige color. Aroma of caramel, coffee, roasted malt. Taste moderate sweet, light to medium body, light bitter and short finish, average carbonation. My favorite every day dark beer.
W aromacie skórka chleba. Ciemna bawa, trochę czerwonawa. Piana w postaci kożucha, Niskie nasycenie. W smaku palone i baaaaardzo wodniste. Słabo, ale bez tragedii.
Butelka. Barwa ciemno miedziana, klarowne. Piana ecrue, drobna, mała. Aromat słaby słodkawy, lekko palony.. W smaku lekko słodkie i kwaskowate. Brak goryczki. Piwo średnio nasycone, wodniste.

Pours deep mahogany colour. Aroma of caramel and a hint of coffee, pleasant. The taste follows the aroma, the bitterness is short, earthy and on a low level. This is a kind of soft beer that you drink to unwind. And in fact it plays its role well.

Butelka z kozłem, piwo ciemne lecz przejżyste, piana początkowo o małej fakturze jednak szybko ją zwiększa i ze średnią prędkością opada, zostawiając trochę śladów na kuflu.
zapach karmelowy wyraźny, niezbyt duże nasycenie, krótki finisz.
Nic specjalnego ani powalającego na kolana ale i tak uważam że jest to naprawdę przyjemne, lekkie piwo, niepowodujące uczucia ciężkości oraz nie trzeba go pić w szczególnych warunkach. Sądzę że może być bardzo dobrą alternatywą do piwa w plenerze lub do grilla dla polskich koncerniaków dla wielu nie smakoszy piwnych.

Butelka 0,5 l. W aromacie karmelowo z nutą kawową i paloną. Piana beżowa, obfita, o średniej wielkości pęcherzykach. Redukuje się stopniowo, ale utrzymuje się do końca. Piwo ma piękną rubinową, wiśniową barwę i jest klarowne. W smaku słodycz i karmel. Goryczka chmielowa prawie nie występuje. Tekstura niska, wysycenie średnie do wysokiego.
50cl can. Pours very dark colour with medium brownish head. Coffee and caramel aroma. Strong coffee taste,medium carbonation and a little bit sweet. Very tasty and easy going beer.
light aroma maybe some chocolate. very dark brown color almost black. this is a really soft beer, but the tase and palate are enough to enjoy.

Draught at Zattl/Wien1. Very good Dunkles, good mixture between sweet and bitter and therefore very drinkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown colour with light brown head. Aroma of roasted malty barleys, caramel. Taste is too sweet, with medium carbonation and low bitterness. Also to sweet and watery finish.
Very good Dunkel. Beautifull color, aroma and a great malty hoppy not too bitter taste.

Wife tried at Lokal on first beer stop in Prague. Really great dunkel-style beer. Soft, sweet. Malty fresh delicious. Had at Easter markets and various stops during the rest of the trip. Served in a glass with a hanging handle - kind of cool.

Ciemnobrązowe, klarowne, bardzo mała sycząca wymuszona jasnobeżowa piana. W aromacie karmel, odrobina kawy i diacetyl (ach te Czechy). W smaku znów karmel i kawa, na szczęście brak masła. Mocne wysycenie szczypie lekko, szkoda że nie goryczka.
Niez?e piwo, ale niezbyt wyraziste dla koneserów piw z ma?ych browarów, du?o lepsze ni? piwo koncernowe.

Aroma: sweet, caramel, dark bread, herbal, some diacetyl and DMS in the background
Taste: sweet, watery, caramel, dark bread, light herbal bitterness, some diacetyl
19.9.2014. Pours dark brown. Aroma of dark malts, some dark fruits and sweet malts. Malty, syrupy sweetish beer.

na szybko - piwo ma smak i aromat - jest karmel, chleb, troche kawy, troche palonosci, troche goryczki. Wodniste. ale i tak jak na koncern - pozytywne zaskoczenie

Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Brown color, nice head. Weak aroma of caramel and dried fruits. Same in taste. Not too sweet happily. Low bitterness. Quite drinkable. Like it.

Bottle 0.5l. Slightly hazy amber with medium off-white head. Strong aroma of prune, dried fruits and cherry with hint of milk chocolate. Sweetish flavor of prune, slightly salty, hint of wood and ash, some roasted malt, a bit watery. Lively carbonation, light to medium-bodied.

Barwa ciemnej miedzi, klarowne. Piana biała, średnio pęcherzykowa, szybko znika. Aromat słabo wyczuwalny. Karmelowy, słodki lekko chlebowy. Wychodzi lekki diacetyl. W smaku już wyraźniejszy diacetyl. Oprócz tego Słodki karmel i bardzo słaba nuta kawowa. Goryczki brak. Lekko wodniste, średnio wysycone.

Bottle. Dark, almost black, clear with small head.
Aroma: Caramel, bread. some diacetyl.
Taste: Sweet. Flavor of caramel, bread, some roasty.
Palate: Very high carbonation, but sweetness decreased drinkability.
Lack of balance and lack of character.
Pours dark brown with small off-white head, Aroma of dark bread, caramel, roasted malts. Medium body, medium carbonation. OK beer.

Сравнивал в Праге разливного Козла и бутылочного в обычном супермаркете - небо и земля. Разливной очень приятен на вкус, слегка сладковат, прекрасно утоляет жажду. Бутылочный - хуже, но все же лучше российского варианта Козела.
Bottle. Dark brown, beige foam. Medium carbonation. Sweet aroma of caramel and light roasted malts. Light bitter hoppy finish. Ok beer.

Dark brown color, 1 finger head. Light gush at opening. 
Aroma is a lot of caramel, bread dough and yeast and sort of a malty lager. Taste is chewy with sugar, brown sugar and walnuts. Crisp mouthfeel. Finish is fleeting with a hint of vanilla
0,5L can. Pours dark ruby with beige head. The head stays. Aroma is metallic, roast, ash. Flavor is sweet, smoke, malt, caramel, nuts. Body is watery. Overall: ok-ish.
Jest dobrze. Pomimo słabego aromatu, piwo ma fajny wygląd i dobry smak. Jest przy okazji bardzo pijalne. Za tą cenę (3,20 zł) mogę pić częściej;)

Bottle 50cl / Botella 50cl
@ El Corte Ingles, Sevilla.
A: Dark brown / Marron oscuro.
T/S: Roasted malt, sweet, slightly chocolate / Malta tostada, dulce, ligeramente a chocolate.
Nice aroma, nice taste, nice colur and appearance. Very good dark beer! Nice designed can.
Nice appearance, nice brown color, weak in taste, nothing remarkable. Thin foam, fast dissolving.

Keg at U Černého Vola Day 1 of Fergus and Sarah’s Czech jaunt. 29/09/14. Caramel brown coloured pour with a light haze, and sticky light cream head. Aroma is sweet malt loaf, some cheese, nutty. Flavour is composed of sweet nutty brown bread, some caramel. Palate is sweet amd thin with moderate carbonation. Bit cloying, not for me.

Botlle in Prague.
Aroma: caramel and some coffee.
Appearance: dark brown color
Taste: medium bitterness at the end of sip
A tökélentes ivó barnasör. Könnyed, abszólút vizes test, mégis karakteres malátás ízérzet. Csodálantos.

Bottle at home. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Roasted malt, caramel, wood, coffee and a bit of chocolate. Weak and only slightly malty and hoppy. Average body and carbonation. Average but pretty good for a 3.8% beer.
How: Bottle Appearance: Dark brown color, tan head. Aroma: caramel, chocolate. Palate: thin body, average carbonation.
Dark mahogany colour, large soapy, than thin beige head. Low alcohol, carbonation is good, pretty much watery. Hard to remmeber.

Pours a dark brown color, topped with a decent frothy beige colored head. Mild roasted aroma, notes of chocolate and coffee in there too. Starts sweet, with a touch of caramel, followed by some mild roasty taste, finishing with a nice bitterness. Easily drinkable but quite light and mild.

On tap at Beerland pub in Smederevo-Serbia. Pours Coca-Cola color, filtered with a frothy and tick off-white foamy head. Nose: roasted malts, smoked hint. Mouth: caramel, cola, watery and easy drinking but far from being terrific. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Mörkt, mörkt brun med ett ganska brunt skum. Doft: Malt, trä, rostat, choklad lakrits, lite romerska bågar. Smak: Malt, honung, lite kaffe, lite apelsin skal.

Draught, found in a Prague restaurant. Little head, subsides quickly, well
 balanced not too sweet, some bitter notes and a hint of caramel. Goes well with their national dish- goulash with knedliki, but otherwise good for once.

500ml can. Pours clear, deep dark brown with a fluffy beige head that seems to dissipate very quickly. Little to no carbonation. On the nose, I faintly picked up caramel, coffee, and black licorice. Very light on the palate, to the point that it feels watered down (of course, it is less than 4%!). No really distinguished flavors besides caramelized malt with hints of coffee and toast. Not a bad beer, but certainly wouldn't buy a six pack again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Deep amber brown with a beige head. Malty sweet caramel base, very low bitterness, faint roasted notes, and moderate sweetness lasting throughout the finish. Not bad.
Draught. Aroma is not very intensive, with some roasted malt. Light sweetness, only slight bitterness. Light body. Nothing special, but goes well with Czech food.

0.5 canned beer. Dark color, light fast fading foam. Water aroma. Awful taste, like drinking spoiled water.
NEW: It is same from the bottle, so not good.
0.5l can. Dark brown color with white/brown head. Aroma is undistinguishable because of overly watery taste. Might be good with 2% more alcohol.

Dark beer de 3,8 % abv (!!??!!) faite en Tchéquie, et d’un niveau abv de 3,8 % ( !!!!???).
C’est ce que l’on appelle une brune simple, par opposition aux double …
D’autre part, l’étiquette nous dit qu’elle est faite avec des « hop products » (!!!).
Tout ceci n’est guère encourageant..
Couleur noire aux reflets roux, quasi opaque.
Mousse beige qui devient très vite un nappage très ténu.
Arômes de malt cara et chocolat, candi, sucre, pointe de blé noir.
1ère bouche douce sur du malt chocolat, candi brun.
Arrière-bouche très douce, mais très sucrée (emploi important de sucre direct).
2ème avec un peu de malt et beaucoup de sucre.
Arrière-bouche limonadeuse.
3ème sans rien d’autre. Longueur tout à fait linéaire.
Levure de premier niveau. 
L’alcool est inexistant (et ils prennent soin d’indiquer « don’t drink and drive » !!!!
Ceci me fait penser qu’on devrait aussi l’inscrire sur les bouteilles d’eau ….).
La finale est plate.
CONCLUSION : une bière brune au ras des pâquerettes … C’est pour cela que le 
bouc sur l’étiquette a l’air aussi content. Tant qu’à faire, on devait lui en mettre une
(de pâquerette ) en travers de la bouche… C’en eut été plus clair … (façon de parler 
pour une noire!!).

.5l can from Supermarket Lutakko Pours dark brown with medium tan head. Aroma is roasted malts, bread, coffee notes, some hops. Flavor is roasted malts, syrup, coffee, dark chocolate and vanilla notes. Niiiice.

dark brown color with toffee head. taste are fine roast malts with light caramel notes and cinnamon. aftertaste are roast malt with light bitter with dark chocolate with vanilla. one of the best Czech beer so far.
Sötét barna szín krémes enyhén barnás hab. Édeskés karamellás illat. Nem igazán testes, kávés pörkölt malátás ízjegyek. Nagyon itatja magát.

Watery, some maltiness, coffee, hints of bitterness in the finish.
One of the worst beers sampled in Prague.

Pours deep dark brown. Aroma is dark malt, texture is very smooth, easy to drink and not with any sharp tastes. Just overall an easily flowing beer, really enjoyed this one more than I figured I would.

14/12/2020
Bottle 500ml. Dark brown with a short grayish beige head. Scent of malt and caramel. Medium thick body with medium-low carbonation and a lightly syrupy mouth feel. Tastes reasonably sweet, very mild bitterness, and low citrusy acidity. Flavors of dark malt, caramel malt, toasted grain, dark bread, malt drink, hints of smoke, some mild hop flavors a bit citrusy-herbal. Simple flavor profile, well balanced and very drinkable.
5/4/4/3/14

11/28/2016
Bottle, 330ml. Pours very dark brown, thick dark gray head. Carbonation is medium-low and body is thick. Tastes quite sweet, with some gentle bitterness. Flavors of dark malt, bready, heavy, toasted, grains. Tastes heavy, but the beer is really easy to drink and lighter then it tastes. Not bad, if somewhat one-dimensional.
5/4/5/3/13

11/28/2014
Bottle, 500ml. Pours very dark brown, with a medium tall beige head. Aroma is mild, with fruits and dark malt. Mouth feel is medium-thick with strong carbonation, watery texture. Taste is slightly sweet, with no bitterness. Strong dark malt flavor. Flavors of dry fruits and raisins, bready, some roasted notes. Very light hop flavor. Somewhat watery flavor. Too simple and flat flavor profile, but OK overall.

In Prague, there were generally two choices of beer at most eateries: pils or dark. The pils was Urquell. The dark was this. It was good overall. Poured dark brown with foamy, slightly brownish head. Not much aroma. Flavor was malty, but a bit on the weak side. Maybe a bit watery. Abrupt finish.
My favorite dark lager from the Czech Republic, and you can find it in several places.

Bottle 0,5l. Very light dark lager, almost without aroma, watery, nice dark malt and roasted coffee beans flavors, but too attenuated. Watery aftertaste. Very drinkable, but I like much more fuller and stronger flavors.

Bottle 0,5l. Aroma of very low intensity; dark malt and nuts. Brown to dark-red color, medium beige head. Taste again of low intensity. Roasted malt, tones of nuts and coffee, little sweet, roasted. Very thin watery body, medium carbonation.
It’s like brown colored water with some hints of beer, in best case like malty juice. Very light, fresh, good to thirst, without bad flavors, nothing bad in it... only is so empty. I understand someone like this, me not.

Tmavá barva, béžová pěna, celkem držící. Vůně karamelová a kávová. Chuť sladší, opět kávová a karamelová, chmělová hořkost nepříliš výrazná. pivo prázdnější a vodovější, ale je to stálě ucházející tmavé výčepní pivo.

Kozel steht für Gemütlichkeit und runde sanfte Biere. So ist es auch bei dem Kozel Cerny (Dark). Die Farbe, Optik und Geruch sind stimmig und angenehm. Leicht Röstgerüche sind zu riechen. Der Einstieg ist so sanft man merkt kaum es handele sich hier um ein Bier. Der Körper ist schon ein wenig dominanter, es könnte sich hierbei aber auch um ein Malzbierhandeln. Insgesamt ein sehr leichtes Schwarzbier, was nur etwas überzeugt aber sicherlich in der richtigen Ambiente munden könnte.
Bottle(24-Oct-2014)Simple sweet caramel aroma.Dark brown,ok head&suds lace.Sweet simple caramel flavour.Caramel light herb finish.
A nice dark lager from the Czech Republic. Tastes completely different to the very sweet Russia-brewed version.

Lovely malty aroma. Pours a dark golden/brown colour with a light tan head that dissipates gradually. Light and smooth on the palette. Mostly malt flavours that are a little lacking. A pleasant drink.

Can from corner store in lovosice
dark brown, amber head, subdued sultana nose, light body, moderate carbonation, sweet, toasty, dry inoffensive

Can. Clear dark brown with a large but diminishing tan head. Aroma is bready, toasted malt, caramel. Flavour is lightly malty, some roast malt, but mainly milky chocolate/coffee and caramel. Basically no bitterness which is a bit disconcerting.
Bottle. Dark brown (clear) with a thin head. Aroma of toasted malt, brown sugar, and a hint of chocolate. Medium body, brown sugar, grain, and a sweet finish.

Can from a small market in Prague. Pours a ruddy amber with a transient tan head. Aroma is a dark malt with a hint of chocolate. Med body or nearly. Flavor matches aroma and now I’m sue there’s chocolate. Arguably a bit of nuttiness. Drinkable.

Pours clear mahogny with medium frothy head
Aromas of roasted caramel, burned bread, german sausage
Nice round taste. Quite sweet with burned caramel notes

Sampled on Prague - Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, and hints of molasses. A dark brown pour with a rapidly dissipating tan head and no lacing. The taste is slightly sweet with flavors of roasted malts, cola, grain, and hints of chocolate. Medium-light body with moderate carbonation. Overall, tasty and very drinkable.

Couleur brune, reflets ambrés, mousse beige qui disparait. Nez malté caramel, note chocolat. Gout caramel doux avec notes de malt et caramel grillé. Fin caramel legerement grillé. Bon corps et super aromes avec si peux d’alcool, bien!
For me it’s a classic among czech corporation-made beers. I like to buy a bottle from time to time. Everybody knows it, so needs no description.
Draught. Pours dark brown/red witj a big creamy head. Light roasted malt aroma. Flavor has almost no bitterness with notes ofchocolate and light roasted malt.
Dark brown body with a beige to light brown head. Aroma is caramel malty, dark grains, some chocolate. Taste is medium sweet with light bitterness. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, refreshing.

Can 0.5 l, from Interspar (Ljubljana). Clear dark brown with a touch of red color liquid. Average tan head. Body light to medium, medium to high carbonation. Light sweetness and bitterness. Aroma of coffee and caramel. Watery, drinkable and not bad but too carbonated for my taste.
This beer is made dor thirsty people. It is excellent if you are thirsty. A nice dark lager!

Typical Czech cerne, the low-alcohol Czech counterpart of Münchener Dunkel. Stable head with light beige colour (not self-evident even in this style as this indeed indicates dark malts being used), colour a bright dark bronze. Agreeable aroma of caramel, brown bread, bitter chocolate, biscuit and bayleaf. Caramel malt taste with slight roasted bitterness, thin and bit watery mouthfeel (due to low alcohol content), light flowery hops in the finish.
Fairly full-bodied with small hints of roasted malt. A little thin but pretty good.
Draft 0.5l at Belgrade Beer Fest 2014 Serbia.Pour it dark brown colour with medium white head.Taste and aroma of roasted malts, caramel and chocolate.Good balanced sweet dunkel beer.
Dark brown beer with tick light brown foam. overly sweet scent of burnt malt, taste and palate reminds me of root beer. Bottom line: completely average beer.

(Bottle) Clear dark brown with loose tan head. Subtle aroma with notes of chocolate, toffee and perhaps coffee. Light to medium body with medium carbonation, with some stickiness. The taste is quite light for a dark beer; it starts with some fairly refreshing tang balanced with some chocolatey malt. The mid palate steadily develops a toffee / sugar sweetness which subsides before it becomes cloying, to be replaced with some vaguely chocolate notes and some very subtle bitterness. It’s easy drinking, un-complex, not great.
Drk brown colour with thick beige head. Average carbonation. Taste is slightly sweet with some roasted notes. Decent tmavy.
Dark, malty. Hints of caramel, nuts, and cocoa. Light, mild, a bit thin overall.

Bottle @ home. ramato carico, riflessi rubino limpida, schiuma beige. aroma piuttosto intenso tostato, di caffè, frutta secca (nocciola), cacao amaro. Gusto secco, forse solo leggermente abboccato, tostato, con retrogusto di caffè e liquirizia. Non molto amara. Poco corposa, poco carbonata, abbastanza rotonda, un filo di astringenza, poco calda. Abbastanza equilibrata ed abbastanza armonica.
50 cl bottle from ICA supermarket. Pours dark brown with a large beige head. Refreshing beer easy to drink. Aromas of caramel and coffee. Light sweet taste. Good brew this one.

Aroma: light toasted malts, bread and caramel malts. Appearance: clear dark brown / black, big beige creamy head. Taste: light sweet and bitter. Palate: light toasted notes, caramel sweets again. Overall: quite nice yet simple aroma and palate. Pint at U Kroka, Prague.

Although Kozel's Svetly is average in its segment, the Černy is quite a good dark lager. It is certainly well flavoured for the style, but still light enough to drink that a session could be had on such a dark beer. Personally my favourite of Kozel's beers.

Deep brown color with a finger thick off white head. Aroma of toffee, mild hoppy and fruity. Medium body. Slight sweet and a mild bitterness. Average carbonation. Toffee, bready, mild hoppy, some roasted notes. Pleasant aftertaste.

500ml bottle @ Humlehof, 23/6-14.
Clear dark brown, 1,5 finger beige head. 
Sweet malty aroma with bread and caramel, slight ashy acidic, some coffee. 
Sweet and berryish flavour with caramel, toast, syrup, oranges, red berries, hints of coffee. A bit watery and ashy. 
Quite thin body, mushy soft carbonation, watery texture. 
Its ok but not more. Refreshing.
Bottle from Old School Cocktail Bar. Poured dark brown red with white head. Aroma of dark malt with dark fruit background. Light carb med bod. Taste of choc dark fruit. Decent
Pleasant caramel and some hoppy bitterness in aroma. Head disappearing to thin layer. Clear black colour. Intensive malty sweetness in taste. Watery and not very exciting.

Aroma: sweet and floral.
Flavor: sweet caramel with sour notes and little bitterness and a watery aftertaste.
Color: brown with a white head.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.

beautiful appearance of dark brown colour with ruby notes and 1 inch creamy beige head; aroma of caramel, dried berries, some ash and earthy notes;taste of malty-caramelic sweetnes with some roastedness and fruity notes; a bit watery, otherwise perfect tmavy

appearance is bad.. but tastes good.
caramel, chocolate, roasty.
good to drink with pizza

Appearance: Deep brown color with a finger thick off white head. Ok lacing.
Aroma: Toffee, mild hoppy and fruity.
Palate: Medium body. Slight sweet and a mild bitterness. Average carbonation.
Taste: Toffee, bready, mild hoppy, some roasted notes and fruity.
Overall impression: Tasty and nice ale. Decent at 3,8% abv.
Personal stats: Bottle from Helmut.

Bottle from SuperValu, Longford [300514]

Caramel brown, clear, nice frothy beige head, good lacing

Aroma of sweet toffee, soft raisin, brown sugars, soft aroma

Taste of soft dark caramel. soft raisin, hint of sweet dark chocolate, peanut shell, very little bitter hops, what is there is pleasant but the flavour is bit weak, even taking into consideration the abv

Palate - soft carb, thin body, fairly sweet. Finish as main flavour, clean soft sweet finish, some nice soft malts in there

Overall - Very easy drinking, better than expected, but the flavour is too attenuated
Bottle. Medium beige head. Roasted nut aroma. Oily texture, with low carbonation. Sweet, but feels slightly watered down for a dark beer. Overall drinkable, but there are better options out there...

Clear dark beer, small head that dissipate very quickly, standard carbonation, sweet coffee cocoa aromas, flavorsome, but sadly a watery aftertaste, and not too much to remember after. The only particularity is that actually for a dark beer the alcohol content is rather low which increase the number of beer you can have, but not the quality of them.

Botella de 50 cl de el c. Ingles, tomada en octubre de 2012. lote 3115 hasta 24-01-2013. Recuerdos agradables para una cerveza de color negro y una pequeña gradación alcohólica de 3.8 que sin embargo aporta un buen sabor, ligeros tostados y algo dulce. Para repetir.
It pours a very dark red, very fizzy head that dissipates quickly. A mild roasty and cocoa aroma, sweet taste but not much flavour.
Hazy dark brown color, brown head. Sweet, malty, grainy, hints of toffee scent. Malty, dry taste. Dry, mineral, sand like aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, medium high bitterness.
Buenisima cerveza de poca graduación, 3.8, con un sabor por el que entiendes la cantidad de premios que tiene, botella de medio litro que se puede repetir sin problemas. Gran negra checa.

Brown reddish cryatal colour with a thin beige head.
Aroma is caramel, sweet, and some roasted malt deep inside.
Taste is plenty of artificial caramel, too sweet and not balanced. Some bitterness would be great to opposite the always present caramel.
Lightly body, dry and some caramel finish.
Too much syrup for me....

On-tap (500ml) from U Pavouka in Prague Old Town (49Czk):

Light malts & roasted notes with caramel & toffee. Relatively light on the nose & features a hint of chocolate and some darker malts too.


Dark, caramel brown bordering on black with a tan brown head come lacing that stuck to the sides as I worked my way down the beer.


Light to medium malts with some caramel & good sweetness. Some bitterness & roasted flavors appear along with some burnt toast with faint chocolate at the end.


Smooth & creamy with a medium body and moderate carbonation that went well with the clean and crisp feel to the beer that was slightly wet in the finish.



The beer mirrored what I’ve come to expect from Czech beers of late, highly drinkable, enjoyable with little to no off-flavors and very easy to drink.

Tap @ Pivohalle. Clear, dark reddish brown color, short-life medium sized light beige head, slight roasted notes, slight sweet malty taste, creamy roasted and toffee palate with very moderate hoppy bitterness. Smooth and well-balanced. Nice one! I love it!

Can. Aroma of malt, caramel, roasted grains. Blackish brown but not black, clear, a nice brownish head. Nice caramel flavor, sweet with some roasted notes, but not too overwhelming. A nice long lasting caramel flavor. Quite a flavored beer for a 3,8% beer, very sessionable.
Drank at a local restaurant in Prague’s little quarter, Nice caramel foam. The taste was malty as expected and very smooth. Definitely one of my favorite draughts here in Prague.
Can 0.5l from local Lidl, Espoo. Originally rated 04092011. Colour is dark brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, some sweetness and roasted malts.

Tap at the Staromestska Restaurant, Old Town Square, Prague. Poured a clear dark brown with a big frothy light tan head. The aroma is sweet malt and caramel. The flavour is medium to light sweet with a sweet watery malt light yeast palate. Light bodied with average carbonation. Not a lot going on but not so bad either.

Dark brown color with reddish hue, average sized brownish head that quickly disappeared. Light to medium body, average carbonation. Texture is disappointingly watery. Aroma is dark fruits, roasted malts, caramel. Medium to high sweet taste, very light bitterness. Nevertheless, it’s quite nice. Too bad it’s so thin and watery... And too sweet...
Well-balanced, caramelly and malty flavor, with little aroma and tiny head. Unexiting, but not bad.
Dark beer with caramel and malt taste. Very low head when poured, light taste and quite drinkable.

Caramel malt, hints of roastiness and milk chocolate, corn. Clear ruby to light brown color. Medium to heavy sweet, caramel, roast, sweet chocolate. Thin body, watery, soft carbonation. Decent but i remember it better.
På flaska @ Cindirella. Mörkt kaffefärgad, Luktar svagt av kola, Bra smak som fyller ut gommen. God.
Flaska@Cinderella. Brunsvart vätska med kaffefärgat skum. Dofter av bränt gummi, kaffe och liten hint av röda bär. Brödig lite fruktig smak.

Clear copper/brown, light brown head
malts, caramel, a hint of winey
caramel malts, a hint of ashes, coffee
watery
330ml bottle. Dark brown body with a medium white head. Malty, with some roasted notes and hops. Quite flat.

Poured on tap in Chisinau Moldova. Pours dark ruby brown with large tan/light brown head that persists. Decent lacing. Aromas of light chocolate, cream, dark breads, subtle dark fruits. Slightly muted. Taste is sweet and has flavors of subtle dark fruits, plum, whole grain bread crust, a slightly nutty (walnut?). Pleasantly carbonated mouthfeel. Finish is sweet and lasting with a medium mouthfeel.

Pours a clear dark ruby colour, with no head. Apart from a strong aroma of metal and stale hops, the aromas are generally mild, with faint notes of caramel and nuts. The taste is sweet and mild, with a fairly long aftertaste. The mouthfeel is thin, watery and fizzy. This beer looks a lot better than it tastes (apart from the non-existent head). One of the ingredients listed is sugar.
One of the better Czech dark beer, has nice taste of caramel and malt. Tasty.
Nice dark beer with aromas of cocoa, malts and plums and of course roasted. Very light and drinkable

Pours no head on a dark brown body.
The aroma is mild roasted malt, dry hay and grain. Pleasant.
The taste is roasted malt with mild lemon and molasses. 
The texture is thin and smooth with moderate carbonation.
It’s a nice dark lager, easy to drink.
Pours in clear dark body with low head. Aroma is caramel, light coffee, weak. Taste is caramel sweet with light bitterness. Weak, watery. Body is medium, water, medium carbonation.
Colour dark brown with average beige head. Aroma: malts, some cocoa, cofee. Taste little bit of caramel, cocoa, malty. Average carbonation. Very good beer.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkelbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, Karamell, leicht würzig. Geschmack angenehm röstmalzig, leichte schokoladige Noten, leicht würzig.
Malty aroma. Lighter in body than the appearance would suggest. Slightly farmy/hay taste.

0.5L bottle, brewed in CZ, poured into glass. Off white head, fast to dissipate. Color is very dark red. Clear and sparkling. Strong malt aroma, with caramel and chocolate hints. Very little hops. Almost no bitterness. Light sweetness, medium body. Average carbonation. Overall - unsophisticated, but very enjoyable beer; better than most common macro lagers (which granted are of the pale variety).

500ml bottle from a local supermarket in Helsinki, Very dark reddish brown colour, large fizzy mostly diminishing off-white head, fair lacing. Aroma of dark bread, molasses, toast and a hint of coffee and floral hops. Taste is initially quite balanced but a bit on the sweet side, turning into a slightly bitter finish with a slightly astringent feel. Lively carbonation, medium body, oily texture. Passable dark lager, the aroma and flavour could be more intense and it would even be good. Didn’t like the very mild hopping either, but I can certainly understand why many people who are not into "beer" as it is known here generally like it. Probably not a bad thing to drink with some pork-related dishes.
Bottle, 500ml. Pours dark reddish brown. Malty, caramel aroma. Sweetish body with some caramel. Medium to thin body.
Duft av malt, rosin og svakt sjokolade. Mørk farge nesten sort. Tyn dekkende skum hinne. Smak av kaffe, sjokolade og Frukt.

0,5l can. Pours red-brown color and small beige head. Very mild aroma of roasted malt and caramel. A bit sweet flavor of caramel and hints of coffee. Light body and soft carbonation. Simple but drinkable.

Poured a deep ruby red colour with a three-finger light tan foamy head that diminished quickly and laced poorly. Carbonation medium. Aroma subtly of roasted grain, sweet malt, a hint of fruit and maybe some chocolate. Taste of sweet malt and roasted malt with no hops bitterness. Light body. Smooth, crisp, clean with a slightly sweet finish. OK
Aivan hyvä aloitusolut, mutta kevyesti vetinen olemus. Mutta ruuan kanssa ihan hyvä. Varsinkin pizzatyyppinen.
Моё любимое пиво. Жаль, не всегда одного качества. Может быть как великолепным, так и посредственным.
Aroma of caramel and a bit roasty. Dark brown color with creamy tan head. Lightly sweet taste with i bitter finish. Very nice dark beer.

On tap @ Õllekraan
Pours clear dark ruby, with a thin bege head. Aroma of malts, honey and milk. Creamy texture with soft carbonation. Taste of malt, cocoa, some lactatic hints.

Deep brown color pour with a pillowy beige head. Aroma of roasted malts; milk chocolate notes. Taste is caramely sweet; faint metallic aftertaste. Slight bitterness; astringent aftertaste. Medium body; moderate carbonation. Pretty good brew.

Canned, 0.50l. Clear ruby brown color with average frothy off-white head and normal visible carbonation. Aroma of caramel, nuts, light roasted malt, chocolate and mild grassy hops. Tastes of sweet caramel, light roasted malt and chocolate. Finish is far more sweet than bitter. Light to medium body, oily texture and soft carbonation in palate. Quite disappointing...
Bottle. Pours dark brown with a finger thick head. Aroma is roasted malts and nuts. Full body with soft carbonation. Flavour is sweet with roasted malts, grain and chocolate.
Reddish, dark brown pour with a small tan head. Some nutty aromas, as well as a tiny bit of sweet liqourice. Medium palate, with a smooth, lactose taste. Light bitterness.

One of my favourite Czechs. Malty, unaggressive aroma, decent head, and porter-like notes of coffee and milk chocolate on the nose. Wonderfully smooth body. Mildly sweet, with an almost maple-like aftertaste, but tolerable even for those who don’t like sweet beers. The perfect match for a typical Czech wintertime meal of Svíčková na smetaně or similar. Could drink this the entire evening.
Draught. Very dark brown, clear, small white head. Honey, dry bread, some toffee. Tastes rather sweet, lightly bitter. Light body, mild carbonation and diluted honey aftertaste.
Dark brown colour with tan head. Caramael and roasted malt aroma and taste. Sweet-bitter finish.

Gutes Durchschnittsbier. 
  
 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Black medium body with beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel and some chocolate. The mouth feels the same, a bit dry. Very limited to no aftertaste.
DAA; Pours dark brown with foamy light tan head. Aroma and taste is roasted malt and caramell with hint of dried fruit, grassy hops. Medium body, thin texture. Short bitter finish.

BOTTLE 50CL. By Efes Moldova. ABV: 3.2%.

Head: beige, medium, frothy to creamy, avg. retention. Colour: red-brown, clear. 

Aroma: caramel, light roast, slightly smoky, dark malt.

Taste: roasted malt, malty, somewhat hollow, CO2 acidity.

Pours a dark amber-brown with a finger and a half of off white head.

Nose is uninspiring. Wet cardboard and some caramel.

Flavour is much the same. Lots of caramel, a hint of smoke, an interesting milk chocolate note, a sweet finish.

Pretty boring, but it’s not bad. Just not good.

Nieudane piwo. Piany brak, w zapachu trochę karmelu, jest on słabo wyczuwalny i nieciekawy. W ustach nic lepszego się nie dzieje, przeszkadzają nuty zwietrzałego chmielu i nadmierna słodycz. Ciężko zmęczyć całość.
0,5 can. Clear mahogany, big tan head. Faint roasted malt sweet aroma. Sweet milky and malty taste, with caramel and toffee notes. Light carbon and body.
0.5L bottle. Dark bread and sweet kvass aroma. Sweet and sour malt and hop mix. Bready, toffee, smoky. Light flavors, but still enjoyable.

Clear dark brown/amber appearance, medium head. Heavy roasted malts, not much hops, strong caramel, coffee and toffee aroma. Very sweet taste, low bitterness. Overall good, similar to Dutch Oud Bruin style.

Very dark brown color, average beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, note of chocolate.Taste is sweet , roasted malt dominate. Smooth bitterness in finish and aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance with brown (almost black) color and medium head.
Aroma of toasted malt (small).
On the palate, the toasted malt is the main flavor.
It is a light beer, easy to drink!
Clear dark amber with light brown lacing foam head. Aroma is coffee, some caramel. Taste is bit dissaointing after the great aroma. No aftertaste it’s gone when swallowed. (Moscow 201310)

Bottle.
Aroma-caramel, chocolate, 
Appearance-black, brown foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-light body, soft carbonation, short finish
Overall-very good
Tap. Brown liquid, beige fluffy head. Stays. Vague aroma. Toasted malts, hay. Light body. The flavour is more intensive. Smooth. Brown bread, treacle, chocolate. Low bitterness. Very drinkable.
Dark brown with a beige head. Caramel malt, light earth sweet, chocolate aroma. Smooth, medium body. Flavor is caramel, malt, sweet, light chocolate. Decent. Very sweet overall with little else.
Nice head and good lace. Good clear brown color. Very smooth and nice. Good level of sweetness and not much bitterness. Pleasant and subtle sweet aftertaste.

Can 0,50L. Clear dark red - amber colour with big, frothy, light brown head. Light aroma of roasted malts, caramel, milk chocolate, brown sugar and honey. Taste is light sweet with caramel note. Medium body, watery texture and soft carbonation. An average dunkel beer...

0,5l bottle from Czech Republic. Clear, reddish brown colored beer with frothy, medium, light brown head, which dissipates slowly. Roasty odor. Delicious aroma with the identities of roasted malt. Toast, hay, light caramel and a little smoke. Dry taste, but after the first impressions some malty sweetness appears. Creamy texture, light body, average carbonation. A bit sweet aftertaste with roast and bread flavour. This beer has everything I expect from a Dark Lager! Perfect in its style. Clear and mature aroma and taste. Pure roasted malt flavour.
Mørk brun farge med beige skum. Blir liggende i kant. lukter caramel. Lite bitter i smak. Smaker lite. Tynn.
Brun i fargen med beige tynt skum. Litt karamell og kandissukkerlukt. Lite smak, litt søtlig. Medium kullsyre.

On tap in Prague at U Kroka ... poured a nice dark brown. Aroma of sweet caramel and cocoa. Body was a little lightier for a dunkel. Overall quite nice; a quite hoppy/tart at the end versus German dunkels but still enjoyable
Dark brown but clear beer with a beige head. Dark bread and syrup on the nose. Thin body. Some caramel and roastiness in the flavors. Decent.

Bought in a supermarket in Kazakhstan. An Efes Kazakhstan beer. I appreciate that this is something a bit different. I did enjoy the milk chocolate taste but felt the beer was too fizzy. I prefered the ’Svetly’ version of Kozel to this one.

A nostalgic beer for me as one of the only dark beers available in the late 90s that wasn't stout - a good point of difference to all the tasteless lagers. Deep brown with a foamy mocha head. Roasted malt, coffee and milk chocolate on the nose. Sweet flavours of roasted malts, nuts,milk chocolate. A very mild bitterness to clean the beer up and make it very drinkable.

Can. Dark mahogany, clear. Brown malts, some cocoa, sweet malts, lager yeast. Body light, sweetish malts. Excellent drinkability. A classic.

-- bb/wp8
Despite its a dark beer, its pretty light with a watery texture, abrupt finish and not much taste or not many aroma.
Pours black with a pillowy tan head. Aroma of toasty grain. Taste is clean and balanced, with a decent amount of both dark malt, clean light malt, and Czech hops.
500 ml bottle. Brown with off white head. Aroma malty and bready with chocolate notes. Taste a bit watery, vague roasted notes, malt and chocolate
Mørk amber farve med gyllent kremet skum. Lukt av malt og sjokolade. Smak av malt, sjokolade og frukt. Supermarked.

500 ml bottle, bought in Greece. Poured into a lager glass. ABV 3.8%
Deep brown amber colour on the body, with a nicely formed, two fingers tall beige head, thick, with very good retention.
Aroma of lightly roasted malts and milk chocolate. 
On the taste little bit of caramel, more of the milky chocolate, some metallic notes. Light bitterness, especially on the aftertaste.
Medium thick body, average carbonation.
Tasty and with high drinkability, quite good.

Bottle. Pours a dark red/black colour.

Aroma, nose of a sweet nutty flavoured coffee.

Taste. Flavours of espresso, sweet roasted nuts and a slight bitterness.

Overall. quite an average beer nothing too special.

0,5L can and bottle with a nice brown design, that tells this is a dark beer, bought in Finland. Pours a very high head coloured as foam from cocoa-milk.
Scents of herbs, hops, some sourness, apples.
Red-brown beer with moderate carbonation.
Deep malty taste, chocolate-bisquit, some droplets water.
Mouthfeel pleasant, well balanced.
Light aftertaste, with some hints of malt and burnt chocolate.
This beer goes well with easy food. It is not a beer you drink 3-5 bottles an evening, but one or two. 
Can rated 7/17/13 and bottle re-rated 8/14/2013. No big diffence from can to bottle.
Bottled ; Central Bohemia ; CZ ; Malt,caramel,spices and light fruity aroma ; Dark brown color with bigger lasting head ; Sweet taste with average finish ; Light body ; Pretty good Tmavy.
Had on tap in Jerusalem at Putin Bar. Was a bit sour and thin. Not a good beer.

500 ml can @ home July 04, 2013
Beer brought back from Saint Petersburg,Russia in April in my suitcase.
Dark brown in color with a white head.
Aroma is malt and some chocolate.
A bit thin and watery beer.
Aroma malty sweet. Appearance dark brown with large-bubbled white head. Malty and ok sweet flavour, Ok

500 ml bottle

Cola brown clear beer with little beige head. Aroma is sweet with bready malts and milk chocolate. Flavor is mild with toffee and malts. Palate is thin with heavy carbonation. Finish has a bite of bitterness. Aftertaste is slightly herbal and malty sweet. Easily drinkable but not that enjoyable.
Bottle dark Brown body with tan not very long lasting head aroma is malt and some sourness taste is malt sweet and some bitterness aftertaste is also malt with some sweetness nice
Can@thorsvej. Three finger beige foam. Smoke Caramalty notes. Fine sweet dry. A bite watery. Allright
Bottle 50 cl. Pours clear brown in color with a tan head. Sweet malty notes, a bit of chocolate notes in aroma. Light mouthfeel. Sweet, some brown sugary notes, just a bit roasted notes perhaps.

Mahogany beer with an average and beige foam, low crackling. Aromas of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, dust. Taste soft and acidulated, choc, point of vanilla, average roundness. Sugary and light beer, hint of grapes, low bitterness. Rather short finale with always choc but lively.

Bottle. Pours dark reddish-brown with a nice head. Smell of roasted malt, caramel and slight sweetness. Taste is very pleasant, a bit sweet, some malty, chocolate and fruity notes. Mouthfeel is light bodied, a bit watery. Very nice dunkel.

Des malts caramélisés construisent la facette chocolatée, fruitée de cette dunkel extrêmement facile à boire. Le côté rôti est très discret, le corps limite aqueux rappelant les bières plus commerciales.

A dark brown beer with a medium and blond head. Aroma of dark bread, ryebread, some syrup and roastiness. Taste is sweet slightly roasted, ryebread, molasses, the aftertaste is sweet. Light+ bodied, balanced carbonation. Quite balanced and tastefull, but of course, too sweet.
Good, slightly burnt taste with a distinct crunchy malt tones and pleasantly balanced bitterness.
Good apearance. Roasty, nuts, smoke, sweet taste, light body. bitterness very low. refreshing
Bottle. Pours a clean chestnut with a little off-white head and minimal lace. Nose of a sweet latte, lightly roasted malts, nut, caramel. Very light body, strong barley flavor, some caramel.
Smak och doft av malt, och toner av choklad. Mycket sötma och en lätt beska.

Reddish brown color, small beige head. Aroma of roasted malt with hints of caramel and coffee. Taste is sour sweet and malty with notes of caramel and dark fruits. Light body and soft carbonation. Nice, drinkable and enjoyable dunkel.

Clear brown color included with great head on top. Lightly roasty aroma. Malt follows the taste to the very end and hint of bitterness comes around to yell from distance in the end. The carbonation in the beer gives nice touch to your tongue and keeps the taste in your mouth for a long time. Overall great beer.

Can. Lots of light brown thin head. Color is dark brown and clear. Faint aroma with malty dark sugar. Taste is dominated with caramellized malts and dark syrup. Still quite light. Very drinkable yet single dimensional and simple.
I wanted a dark beer and I ordered it almost by chance.It was a very nice surprise. I really enjoyed it.

I was very surprised, when I realized, that I didn’t rate this beer, although I drunk it several times in past. So I gathered it and I am ready to rate. Bottle. Dark chestnut color with medium light beige head. Roasty aroma with caramel, hints of bitter hops. Taste, roasted malt, caramel, some fruitiness, hints of coffee. Light bitterness in dry finish. Easy drinkable.

Bottle 50cl, a dark beer with low head. Nose is on caramel notes, aroma is nice on caramel, brown malt, toffee, roasted malt, nice body for such a low alcohol level. Caramel and toasted cereal on aftertaste good !
0,5l bottle. Dark brown color. Aroma is roasted malt and caramel. Taste is roasted malt and a little bit sweet. Overall it is great beer, very drinkable.

Bottle. Caramel and candy sugar in the aroma, with subtle notes of coffee, chocolate and licorice. Boring but quite allright. Taste is too sweet and too evidently caramelly. Faintly bitter and faintly coffeeish finish. Passable as a breakfast beer.
Bottle- Nice dark colour with a dark foamy head. A nice beer with a good malt profile.
A not bad and light beer. In the aroma one finds some sweetness from dark malts. The saturation is pretty high. One of the significant disadvantage is metallic taste.

On tap @ Pavel Ploc, Harrachov. Pours clear dark brown with stable, thick light tan head. Clear aroma of malt and caramel. Sweetish taste of malt with notes of roast, caramel and fruit. Dryish aftertaste. Would be better without the metallic finish, but it’s ok.

On tap at The Czech Inn, Dublin. Deep reddish brown colour with thick off-white head. Aroma is heavy caramel, light red fruit, and a slight vegetal note. Taste brings a lot of rich, sweet caramel with some hints of herb and red/dark fruit (although not too much to be honest). Pretty sweet all round with a lot of lingering sugary caramel stuff going on - becomes fairly cloying after a while. Not too bad, but I can't imagine drinking too much of this.

Pours a deep brownish color with a healthy tan head that fades slowly to good lacing. Aroma of dark fruit, roasted malt bit of chocolate and spice. Taste of dark fruit, some chocolate, roasted malt and bit of coffee in the background. Very mild bitterness and a slightly sweet finish.. Moderate body, a bit on the light side. Smooth and creamy but missing something to make it distinctive. Decent beer but comes up a bit short for a Czech beer.

Bottle shared with McTapps. A nice surprise ! But a watery one... Nice aroma of malt, sugar and fruit combined with a slightly sweetish taste. Maybe due to its low alc this one seems to be a bit watery. Put it up to 5,5 % and the same taste, then you’ll get a 4,2 in the score !

Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Clear dark ruby-brown in colour with low head. Thin body, nose of pumpernickel. Taste of brown sugar, caramel, light nuts,  brown bread and syrup. Too sweet and light for me.
Aroma has dark bread and malts. Nice dark head, and color is dark brown. Smooth and fulfilling flavor, dark malts bring some sweetness. It’s like bread that is transformed into beer, brilliant!

Wonderfull foam and beautifull colour. Good taste but no character. Reminds a bit of "kvas" because too much sweet. More hops and roasted syrup and it would be on level 4. Very easy to sip and composition feels good in mouth. One is enough.

Pours dark brown with a good off white head.  Nose is very sweet raisins and caramel, with some light chocolate and coffee.  The taste is sweet mostly with a hint of bitter in the middle.  The mouthfeel is crisp and clean, body is light and the finish is long.

Pours light brown with amber highlights, thin foam head that quickly disappear.
Smells malt and cane sugar. Taste is malty, bready. Palate is watery, finish is very short.
Dark brown body, light brown head. Aroma has bready malt, nuts and butter. Pretty much whole flavour is the same. Dull and very plain beer.

#259
Tiefes dunkelbraun, fast schwarz mit reichlich bräunlichen Schaum. Ein röstmalziger Ton im Aroma. Im Antrunk dann malzig mit schönen Geschmacksnoten nach Kaffee und Bitterschokolade. Für diesen niedrigen Alk.Gehalt erstaunlich gut und keineswegs dünn geraten. Im Abgang kommt dann eine dezente Hopfennote zum vorschein. Hervorragender Begleiter zu den leckeren Topinky wie Bierkäse und deftigen Ertrunkenen Würstchen.
	
Test vom 6.12.2009, Gebinde: Fass 	Noten: 12,10,12,12,-,12 - 11,68

On tap. Nice dunkel, a bit watered down, but  i suppose this due to the style (i´m waiting for a more bodied dunkel...). Nice roasty and caramel aromas. Pours dar, with amber reflections, with a cremy head and average carbonation.Aftertaste is sweet.
Draft in Split, Croatia. Tart dark malt aroma. Sweet rich cola, root beer. Probably too sweet. pretty tasty though .

I like this beer almost as the most common beer to a dish. The biggest advantage is good quality of bottled beer, is here available in several pubs from tanks too, however its quality is decent even if bottled. Excellent in combination with meat, (like turkey, chicken, duck...), roasted potatoes etc. This beer has 2 states - alone and with food. Alone: 3, With food: 4.5 
Much better than the most of commonly available czech brown/black beers. Only pilsner Master is comparable to this beer.
Una cerveza facil de beber de aspecto oscuro y con poca retencion de espuma. Sabor dulce al inicio que deja paso a notas tostadas sin mayores complicaciones. Sencilla y con poco cuerpo.

500mL thanks to Ruben! Pours high carbonated clear mahogany, soapy, tan to coffee head. Good retention, some rockiness. Stays around for a good while. Nose is metallic with lemon tea and detergent. Taste is very watery, lemon tea, soap, hints of coffee and chocolate.

Can at home. Mild aroma with some sweetness. Very sweet taste and some watery too.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice, mellow roast grain flavor. SOme dark chocolate bitterness also noted. Aroma is almost coffee like,  Dark brown, almost black in color with slight skin of a beige head. This is one tasty beer, and easy to drink.
Tap. Dark, nice head. Aroma has some roasted malts and sweetness. Taste has sweetness, malts. Low carbonation. Very nice.
Bottle at home. Black color with white head. Roasty sweet aroma. Nice malty body with roasted malts. Low co2.
Can in Chisinau, Moldova. Dark maroon color, small tan head. Aroma of subtle burnt coffee. Taste is weak and dilute coffee and caramel.
50cl can. Neutral nose. Dark chocolate color and light brownish head. Balanced body with nice crisp bread taste. Smooth and enjoyable but not all the way.

Ruby brown with beige large foamy top, that lasts quite a bit
Aroma.. light roast, malty. not very rich
Taste.. moderate sweet, quite roasty
It is good "easy going" lager type dark beer that is good choice for shopping in supermarkets,  thou its too poor to enjoy in beer pub

50 cl bottle.

Originally rated on 20090215.

Pours dark red color with a small head. Aroma of malt,s caramel, toffee and some sugar. Flavor of sugar, caramel, malts and some syrup. Very sweet.

Pours a dark mahogany.
Roasted, malty aroma, chocolate, coffee.
Off-dry, light to medium body, low bitterness, balanced CO2.
Malty, roasted taste, ashes, chocolate, licorice.
Balanced, very smooth. (2012-09-12)

Nice ruby-like body, with an average light brown head that diminishes quickly, leaving almost no lace. Faint malty aroma, wine-like taste, light sweet. No aftertaste at all. Medium body, medium carbonation, watery texure. Pretty much disappointed by this one.
Nice dark thick headed dunkel with a nice malty aroma and chocolate flavour with cofffee hints over a roasted malt. Quite a long dry finish.
Very dark pour with a big head and a nice full mouth.  Lots of roast and chocolate.  Very easy to drink.  Grain and roast on the nose.  I liked this one.
Can from super market. Dark brown color, beige head. Roasty taste with plum, liquorice, malts, nuts and toast. Malty, sweet finish. Very nice dunkel.

Dark brown body and mind creamy tan head. Nice. Dry roasted nuts, earthy, dades and dry yeast. Good malts but a boring yeast, I think. Taste is a bit roasted will nice enough sweetness and not too metallic in after taste. Better than expected, although not super exciting. Still too dry in the end for me. Okay. (50cl bottle)
Quite tasty given the abv. Though there’s something not quite genuine in smell and taste... dunno what.

Hace ya un tiempo que la probé en caña y me dejó un buen sabor de boca, y aunque pertenece a SABMiller, por España casi no está extendida, lo que ha hecho que no la haya podido volver a probar. Recuerdo su extraordinario aroma, unido a una apariencia dunkel muy atractiva. Sabor agradable, casi poco tostado...podría situarla a mitad de camino de una Bohemian y una Dunkel. Buena cerveza.

Dark brown with amber tinges, tan head. Nose is big on the caramel and roasted malt fronts with coffee notes and bread. Tastes is also big in the roasted malt department. Slightly salty caramel finish with some hops in there. Easy to drink, but pretty thin.

Bottle at home.
Brown/ light brown color. 
One finger foam not so brown as they claim. 
 Malty aroma with small bitter aftertaste.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Used to be my favourite beer many years ago. Now that my taste for beer has ostensibly developed, it doesn’t feel quite so tasty anymore. Very sweet (apparently artificially sweetened), a bit smoky, but still quite watery. Yet is often the best beer in many bars with not so good selection...

A-- Poured a dark brown crimson color with a light brown head that quickly faded into a film on the beer. Swirl the glass and the head does come back and fade away just as fast. A little watery as a lot of light is getting in the glass

S-- Some carmel malt but a fairly large over roasted or burnt malt smell. Smells a little sweet, some cherries but thin

T-- Carmel and roasted malt and pretty watery. A little bit of sweetness, cherries and a bit of chocolate but not a lot.

M-- Clean and a bit sweet. Does not stand out all that much.

D-- Workable dark lager. Would get bored with this after one or 2 of these. Mostly sweet and refreshing. I would not let this get too warm. Decent warm up beer for the night but not real memorable. Low ABV and easy to drink. Just not that complex.
On tap in Prague. Pours a dark brown with an aroma of roasted malt and caramel. Flavor is watery, of some roasted malt, but lacks flavor and is very light.
0,5l bottle. Dark brown color with orange highlights. Nice brown head. Malty aroma with notes of caramel and bread. Sweet taste with notes of caramel, coffee and hops. A good beer.
Another masterpiece, not. On tap in Berlin, dark appearance but without taste, flat and watery. 3.8 % come now.
Průměrné tmavé pivo plzeňskýho typu. Pít se dá, ale nic extra. V kombinaci se světlou jedenáctkou je jako řezák mnohem lepší.
Really dark brown colour with medium head. Aroma is sweet malt and caramel. Flavour is caramel, sweet, watery.
Mörkt brun öl med ljusbrunt skum. En klassisk tjeckisk mörk laget med rostade toner i doft och smak men med lätt kropp.
0,5l bottle. Very dark brown almost black color. Medium beige head, stays. Malty, mild coffee in aroma. Watery, coffee, honey in flavor.

On tap and in the bottle on many occasions. Another decent Czech beer from a mega-brewery. Nice brown colour, sweet smell. Sweet taste and some caramel. Pleasant after-taste. Another totally unspectacular, available everywhere, Czech beer.

On tap in Prague.
Dark  amber, good foam.
Malty aromas, roast notes.
Medium/light body & complexity.
Pretty ok beer
Brown colour, medium, lasting head. Slight notes of roasted caramel, not too sweet, well balanced overall. Smooth end.
Really light one, good taste for the little amount of alcohol in it. I recommend it!

Bottle, from an ethnic food store in Scunthorpe. Deep red brown, thin shortlived off white head and moderate condition. Initial berry fruitiness in the nose soon gives way to a sweet caramel note, a slight peppery spiciness and a faint phenolic smokiness. Quite thin in the mouth with a powdery chocolate note giving way quickly to fruty berries and a gentle buttery sweetness laced with burnt toffee, dry in the finish with some burnt maltiness but ultimately quite thin.

500mL bottle.  Great aroma, solid pour...dark head looks delicious.  The taste is awesome, one of the best dunkels I’ve ever had.  Mouthfeel is great, the body is light & just right for the style.  Really enjoyed this dunkel.
Can. Pours dark brown with medium brown non-lasting head. Aroma is malt syrup and caramel. Taste is medium sweet. Body is watery with soft carbonation. Finish is short, sweet and metallic.

Bought in Prague early 2009, but is it brewed in Russia now? This brown 500ml bottle had 5 days left on its ’Best before date’ when I reviewed it on a cold, wet and dark night in September 09.

Poured (twice) into a Westmalle chalice; looked good, dark, almost black body with a good, well formed tanned head. When held up to the light you could see it was clear and a deep reddy brown colour really.

The smells sent mixed messages to my brain, sweet yet bitter dark chocolate and liquorice esters vied for my attention.

The taste had no liquorice, and the bitterness of the dark chocolate also failed to turn up in the flavours, just the sweetness of the aforementioned dark chocolate was evident.

Lacks body and substance in its bottle form, drank from a tap in Prague I thought it sweet, but it had more depth of body and character. Disappointed with the wishy-washy bottled version and it is my last beer from prague that I obtained to review, wish I’d kept something else back now.
Thin body ,sickly sweet chocolate aroma and taste,very disappointed,bottle looks good is the only positive.

I was positively surprised, when I first drank this beer. Some may say it’s for woman - when you sitting in Prague’s "hospoda" (pub) you’ll see women drinking it. Excellent taste - you can find a little caramel aroma there, but not to strong. Good foam, stays long on top. Great colour, dark but not black. One of the best beers I ever drank.
Bottled, Norway. Malty, slightly metallic taste. A bit bland, with little aftertaste. Looks better than it tastes.

500 ml can. Pours ruby brown with a large foamy espresso head. Aroma is pleasant but litlle bit weak with some roasty and caramel malt and some metallic notes. Taste is sweet with caramel & roasty malt and raisins. Low carbonation, medium bodied and watery but smooth mouthfeel. A great and well-balanced everyday beer with a good availability.

Can, Finland. Light brown head. Red brown body. Malty aroma. Taste is malty and medium sweet, a little bit of coffee and metal. The taste is also very thin. Drinkable beer, good after sauna and with game meal but nothing too special.
I remembered this as very meaty, but it was thinner than I remembered. Maybe my taste has just developed. Not a bad beer it’s both dark and fresh but nothing special.

Bottle. Pours a dark ruby amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty caramel chocolate aroma. Slightly roasted malty caramel chocolate flavor. Roasted malty caramel finish with weak hints of chocolate in the aftertaste.

50ml bottle. The aroma gives you both chocolate, caramel, citrus and coffee. Taste is much of the same, without the citrus. Not a world class beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50ml bottle. The aroma gives you both chocolate, citrus and coffee. Quite dark head. Taste is much of the same, without the citrus. A thorough and cozy  chocolate beer, not world class, but a nice companion.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Alko, Kouvoula. High fluffy light brown head that lasts. Dark red color. The aroma has lots of Munich maltiness and not much else.  Sweet malty taste with a fine light roasted taste. Nice sparkle but a bit thin body.
cereal, grass, leaves, soy sauce, smoke, rotten eggs, skunky, brown, frothy, brown foam, cloudy, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,
Very nice. Stick to Czech tradition, sweet but with character. I could drink amny of these.

Black dark brown clear body with beige creamy long lacing head. Aromas are lirocire malts, roasted malts, grass, plum fruit or herbs. Palate is slick soft medium-bodied, with soft smooth carbonation and mouthfeel. Taste is sweet roasty, raisins and medium dryness. Aftertaste sweet malty and with dry medium finish. Overall good dunkel, smooth and drinkable.
My favourite beer! Coffee, black, lightly bitter, medium sweetness, caramel,
