One of my alltime favourites in the pub. Perfect dark brown colour with good head. Taste is easily drinkable malty and sweet vanishing with the pleasure at the end. (7/5/8/5/18 4.3) 

Re-rate, bottled (BB 11/2004)

Dark ruby, espresso head. Roasted malt, dark chocolate aroma. Medium-bodied, sweet and roasted palate with late carbonation. Some hoppy bitterness in oily aftertaste as well as the notes of toffee. (6/5/7/3/15 3.6)

Re-rated, can (BB 01/2006)

Dark ruby, nice tanned head. Caramelly and grassy nose. Easy to drink, sweetish with light hops. (6/4/7/4/14 3.5)

Re-rated 24 nov. 2004. What really makes this beer stand out, is its roasted malty aroma with lots of dark fruit. Flavor is also sweet with dark grapes and raisin. Goes perfect with danish christmas food.

Dark ruby brown clear under a medium size short lasting beige head. Faint soapy roasted malt aroma. Medium light body low carb mouthfeel. Medium intensity sweet generic cola and roasted malt flavours. Malty cola like finish and aftertaste. Somewhat one dimensional.  Lo al probably doesn't help retain/develope any complexity. Gets a lot worse as it warms - something like an artificially sweet weak black iced instant coffee.
(dutch ratebeer meeting) Smell is not great; hoppy, bit skunky. Clear, dark coloured with a thin head. Taste is malty. Thin and smooth palate. I can't be too excited about this one.
Wow, what a nice beer! Very low on alcohol (3,8%) but still great. Nice white head and almost black body. Beautiful!! Great sweet taste, it's like eating candy. Smooth to the bone.

This is absolutely my favorite Czech beer - hands down!  As a Dunkel, it is very sweet and light in body.  Lo-alcohol makes it extremely drinkable.  It's also lightly carbonated - another plus.  This baby's got it all, I swear!  It is magnificent!  It has a light-to-medium malt body with caramel malt flavors.  No hops to be found whatsoever.  I'll bet not one was dropped in the brew kettle unless it was a mistake.  Amazing!!  I could drink at least two more.  It's only weaknesses are that the aroma isn't remarkable (how could it be when the taste is so mild?) and the head retention is poor.

(Canned) Darkish ruby brown with a lasting head. Mild, sweetish, burned-malty and slightly nutty aroma. Quite sweet, burned-malty, slightly toffeeish flavor. Some carbonated bitterness in the finish. Light to medium-bodied, quite thin palate with lemonadey carbonation. Well, at least the canned stuff is similar to bottled. Too thin, too sweet.
(Bottled) Deep, dark walnut/red color with a thick and creamy, mostly vanishing, off-white head. Slightly nutty and roasted, earthy and sweetish aroma. Flavor starts off dry and burned, but turns into sweet and sugary-malty towards the end. Slight bitterness in the short finish. Sweetish, roasty aftertaste. Light to medium-bodied, slicky, quite thin and lemonade-like carbonated palate. A very easily drinkable, sweetish and thin, but decent-quality dunkel.
I discoverd this beer during my last trip to Praha.  Does anyone know how to get it in the states?
It has a pleasant look about it, with a small lacy head.  Quite toffeish but I agree as far as dark beers go it is quite light - but in the same token - rich.  Not bad at all. cheers

Quite rich, sweet, little bit of grainy earthy coffee flavour. one of those beers that you can enjoy one of but wouls struggle on the 2nd or the third. Too rich, too sweet, but nice complex flavours all the way though. Give it a go definately.

Draught at The Rover, Gothenburg.
Dark brown with a beautiful head.
Toffee-aroma.
A bit thin with a short flavour from toffee and chocolate.
Clear brown colored, brown head. Aroma and flavour of malts and rye, caramel and coffee. Lasting bittersweet finish. Magnificent Dunkel, especially considered the ABV.
Clear ruby dark color, creamy large head. Aroma is caramel, coffee and toffee. Taste is like cold coffee almost, mocca with sugar on top. But very good!

Deep brown colour, nice head, quite persisten. Caramel and chocolate aroma. The flavour is quite sweet, with liquorice, chocolate and caramel traces. A touch of bitterness in the finish Well balanced, really light and drinkable.

Lightly malty, sweet background flavours of chocolate and roasted caramel. Really easy drinking with a slightly sweet aftertaste. At 3.8% in a 500ml bottle you could drink a few of these in a night without imparing your driving. Great first drink of the night as well if you are moving onto heavier Dunkels or Bocks.
This is a nice "light" beer. Nice taste but lacks a bit of depth. A dark beer for hot summer days.

Dark brown. Medium sized, short-lived head. Malty nose with chocolate and roast caramel. Feels and tastes weak, which of course isn’t a lie, but it does so in a very pleasant way.
I can imagine why Czech dissidents would sit up all night discussing politics with this kind of beer.

A beautiful burnt chocolate malt aroma as soon as you open the bottle. Low hop that is nevertheless compensated by the palate. A final sweet finish with a subtle lacing. I am impressed by the coppery colour of the beer that somehow seems to compensate for the lack of alcohol mouthfeel. This is the best midstrength beer I have tasted
Have they mixed this beer with cola?? It's appearance is like cola, and the aroma and flavor is mainly sweet, perhaps a little burnt caramel.

The last of my good beers to rate and the last on the shelf at the liquor store had to blow the dust off of it,but i just had to have it.Very dark color light amount of head that didnt last to long.Aroma was decent,malty sweet,with some coffee in it.Taste was ok not real fantastic,malty sweet taste,coffee some hints of licorice,bitter chocolate slight bite in the after taste.Not bad but i think it will be the last one for me it wasn't as good as i thought it might be.
(tap)Dark brown color, fair off-white head. Fine aroma with a hint of chocolate and caramel.  Watery palate feel. Not my type of beer, but ok.
Nice head and good lace.  Good clear brown color.  Very smooth and nice.  Good level of sweetness and not much bitterness.  Pleasant and subtle sweet aftertaste.  I liked this!

(500 ml bottle). Moderate head, dark reddish brown colour. A very flavourful dunkel despite the low ABV - malty, rounded caramelly sweetness, low bitterness. Not bad - would like to try it on tap. 
Rerate draught in Prague, compared to Krusovice Cerne: Sweeter than KC, smaller head, more carbonation, less hops, less roastiness, lighter body. Overall 13/20.
Is that some chocolate malt I smell before me? Taste has some coffee-like bitterness but needs more actual flavour, more depth and power. Also quite watery.
Beautiful dark colour with good head. Although this beer is very mild and slightly thin because of the low alcohol content it has many nice aroma and flavour notes. It is quite caramelly and malty.

Dark brown coloured. Aroma: malty, sweetish with hints of chocolate and some liquorice. Flavour: Malty, sweetish(hvidtølsagtig), chocolate, liquorice with a hint of smoke. Medium-bodied and smooth to drink.
A very fullbodied Schwarzbier in my opinion( I´m not sure what the difference between a Dunkel and a Schwarz is ) In spite of it´s low ABV it gives you a bigger impression than you expect.
This is like the Czech hockey, smooth full of body with a firm head.Malty, dark but a cerain sweetness combinede with the bitterness.

dark brown color. Foamy tan head that dissapears after some minutes. Not that much aroma, just a hint of chocolate. A sweet surprisingly light taste with an elegant spicy finish that goes on and on. You got to love czech pils!
Dark brown color, sweet malt. Dry and low alcohol. Good flavour. Nice dunkel.

Fantastic aromas, the best I''ve experienced on any beer, Floral notes ( peace roses!? ) surrounded by big burnt malty nose. This carries through the slightly watery texture and delivers a clean burnt malty flavour. Astringent finish was a similar experience to the Kozel premium. Strong hoppiness too. Very dry, but overall a well developed flavour for 3.8%abv.

Nice dark brown colour
I am impressed by the long aftertaste for such a weak beer. Kind of light but with a long lasting hopbitter finish.

Dark brown colour with a decent off-white head. Nice aroma that is dominated by chocolate (and roasted malts). Lightly sweet, very smooth flavour with hints of chocolate and caramel. If this beer had a higher ABV (with a better palate and longer finish etc.), this would be an excellent beer. However, I really do like this beer - the taste just dies too quickly.
A beutiful dark red colored beer. With a good taste of the sweetness of the malt. A good and very drinkable beer.
best of the Czech dunkel beers! Very smooth with a great aroma! Great with beef!
Bottled: Fine dark colour with good foam. Light aroma with a scent of chocolate. Taste a little waterish (fruitjuice) but has a nice taste of chocolate and coffee.

Light roasted aroma with also some caramel and a hint of chocolat. Dark brown colour, fair lace. Light and refreshing. Light sweet, light roasted, chocolat. Long roasted finish with hint of coffee. If it only had a bit more body.
